On 19 June 2010 23:58, Ken <kstanley@...> wrote:
>
> Colin, congr=
ats. SharpNEAT has been a great resource and I am sure 
> version 2 will be=
 appreciated. I was wondering how you feel about 
> the HyperNEAT component=
 of SharpNEAT 2.0. Do you consider a full 
> release of HyperNEAT? That is,=
 is it an alternative to the two 
> current releases that we have out?


Hi=
 Ken, thanks. Yes as of this release I'm happy to declare it a full
impleme=
ntation of HyperNEAT; That part of the code in particular has
been through =
a few changes over the last few weeks and months - e.g.
initially the subst=
rate was limited to 2D whereas now the
dimensionality is not actually limit=
ed. Implementing the 'boxes'
visualization task highlighted that issue and =
a few other defects and
design niggles that have been ironed out.

The main=
 question I foresee is the speciation by k-means which I want
to do a bit o=
f investigation on - some kind of visualization of the
species/clusters to =
confirm it works as expected and maybe identify
some improvements. However =
the NEAT code (which the HyperNEAT code is
of course built on) is performin=
g at least as well as in SharpNEAT 1.x
so I don't foresee any problems ther=
e.

And of course if anyone here would like to see a particular HyperNEAT
t=
ask implemented to help prove/test the codebase then I'd be happy to
have a=
 look (depending on how much work is involved :)

Colin
